revisions.rev:
{{Infobox national football team | Name = France | Flag = Flag of France.svg | Badge = | FIFA Trigramme = FRA | Nickname = Les Bleuets (The Little Blues)
Les Tricolores (The Tri-colours) | Association = [[French Football Federation]] | Confederation = [[UEFA]] ([[Europe]]) | Coach = [[Jean-Claude Giuntini]] | Captain = [[Jean-Charles Castelletto]] | Most caps = | Top scorer = | pattern_la1 =_fra11h|pattern_ra1=_fra11h|pattern_b1=_fra11h | pattern_ra1 =_fra11h|pattern_so1=_fra11h|pattern_sh1=_fra11h | pattern_so1 =_fra11h| leftarm1=2225AA|body1=2225AA|rightarm1=2225AA|shorts1=FFFFFF | socks1 = FF0000 | pattern_la2 =_fra11a|pattern_b2=_fra11a|pattern_ra2=_fra11a | pattern_sh2 = |pattern_so2=| leftarm2=FFFFFF|body2=FFFFFF | rightarm2 = FFFFFF|shorts2=2225AA|socks2=FFFFFF }} The '''France national under-17 football team''' is the national under-17 football team of [[France]] and is controlled by the [[French Football Federation]]. The team competes in the annual [[UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship]] and the [[FIFA U-17 World Cup]], which is held every four years. The under-17 team also participates in local and international friendly tournaments, such as the [[Montaigu Tournament]] and the [[Toto Cup]], which is held in [[Austria]]. France have won the FIFA U-17 World Cup once in [[2001 FIFA U-17 World Championship|2001]]. However, of the 18 players that played on the championship-winning team, only one of them has played in the [[France national football team|senior team]] of France; [[Florent Sinama-Pongolle]]. Several players on the team, such as [[Hassan Yebda]], [[Mourad Meghni]], [[Chaouki Ben Saada]], and [[Emerse FaÃ©]] have played for other national teams for which they were eligible. The under-17 team has also won the [[UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship]] once in [[2004 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship|2004]]. The championship-winning team began a new generation for the senior national team as it was composed of several players who have established themselves as French internationals. [[Samir Nasri]], [[Karim Benzema]], [[JÃ©rÃ©my Menez]], and [[Hatem Ben Arfa]] have all gone on the represent the senior team with two of them participating in a major international tournament for France. The 2011â12 international under-17 campaign began on 21 August 2011 and the team is coached by [[Jean-Claude Giuntini]], a former football player. Prior to coaching for the French Football Federation, Giuntini had a domestic coaching tenure at [[ESA Brive]] from 1986â1995. The current captain of the team is [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]] defender Jean-Charles Castelletto. ==Players== ===Current squad=== *The following players were called up to participate in the [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship qualifying round|first round of qualification]] for the [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship]] that was played from 28 October to 2 November.{{cite news | url= http://www.fff.fr/individus/selections/der_selection.php?id_selection=10 | title = 1er Tour qualificatif Euro 2012 du samedi 22 octobre 2011 au jeudi 03 novembre 2011 | date = 17 October 2011 | accessdate = 17 October 2011 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}} ''Caps and goals are as current as the squad's match against Northern Ireland on 2 November 2011.
